title: Chicken Stock
ingredients: a 4-pound chicken; the neck and giblets (excluding the liver), chopped
a cheesecloth bag containing 6 sprigs of parsley, ½ teaspoon dried thyme, 1 garlic clove, and 1 bay leave
instructions: In a kettle combine the chicken, the neck and the giblets, and 12 cups cold water.  Bring the water to a boil, and skim off the froth.  Add ½ cup cold water and bring the stock to a simmer, skimming any froth.  Add the onion, the leeks, the carrots, the celery, the salt, and the bag of herbs and simmer the stock, skimming any froth, for 2 hours.

Remove the chicken from the kettle and when it can be handled, remove the skin and the meat from the chicken.  Reserve the meat for another use.  Chop up the bones and return them to the kettle, and simmer the stock, adding boiling water if necessary to keep the ingredients barely covered, for 2 hours more.
Strain the stock through a fine sieve into a bowl, pressing hard on the solids, and let it cool.
Chill the stock and remove the fat.
